The @CityofLebanon has a lot to offer & Claire was proud to call it home. Thanks for joining in our #MissouriSpotlight this week!
Today @CityofLebanon is home to 14,000 people & approx. 1 mil visitors who enjoy this town on the edge of the Ozarks. #MissouriSpotlight
The @CityofLebanon – close to Bennett Spring State Park – attracts trout fisherman taking in the current season. #MissouriSpotlight
The @CityofLebanon’s magnetic waters were said to have healing powers & visitors came to drink and bathe in the water. #MissouriSpotlight
Unique Fact: In 1889 a worker digging a new well in @CityofLebanon found the water had magnetized his tools #MissouriSpotlight
RT @CityofLebanon: #FunFactsFriday  https://t.co/24Cokam042
The railroad came to Lebanon in 1868 & served as a boost to the city’s economy by attracting commerce to the rural area #MissouriSpotlight
The @CityofLebanon’s name came from one of its leading citizens, Rev. Benjamin Hooker’s hometown in Tennessee #MissouriSpotlight
Lebanon, located in Laclede County, was established in 1849 and became a #Missouri 4th Class City on October 17, 1877 #MissouriSpotlight
Claire’s family moved to the @CityofLebanon shortly after she was born, where her family ran the corner drug store. #MissouriSpotlight
This week, we’re taking the #MissouriSpotlight to Claire’s childhood home - the @CityofLebanon in Southern #Missouri http://t.co/NyzWi5855t

#PCAPact reforms fed programs to strengthen oversight & coordination when giving equipment, funds to local law enforcement.

Claire: I look forward to learning more about this and other emerging technologies from Dr. Skubic’s testimony. #ProtectSeniors
Claire: Dr. Skubic & her @Mizzou team have found a way to use radar & 3-D sensors to monitor seniors’ risk level for falls #ProtectSeniors
(2/2) Claire: I am pleased to introduce Dr. Marjorie Skubic, Dir of @Mizzou Center for Eldercare & Rehabilitation Technology.
Claire: These innovative technologies are being developed by researchers all across the country, one of whom is w/ us today (1/2)
Claire: Pillbox sensors are simple in nature, but can prevent tragic accidents by making sure seniors aren’t mixing meds #ProtectSeniors
Claire: Developers are creating elder-specific monitoring devices such as bed & pillbox sensors to help monitor activity w/in the home
Claire: Recent advances in technology are providing new options for seniors & their families that allow them to remain at home longer
Claire: While it’s not possible for every person to remain in their homes, for many w/ right support, it’s possible #ProtectSeniors
Claire: There’s disconnect b/w number of seniors who want to stay in their homes &number of seniors who have to move to assisted living
Today's Aging hearing on elder-care tech will feature Dr. Marjorie Skubic, Dir of @Mizzou Center for Eldercare & Rehabilitation Technology

Claire: I am eager to hear from @FTC & law enforcement today about what they are doing to go after these fraudsters & alert the public.
Claire: One woman lost $15,000 after a man claiming to be #IRS agent threatened arrest, a lien on her assets & notification of employer.
Claire: The Better Business Bureau of SW #MO estimates 100s of ppl have been called & are calling this scam an epidemic. #ProtectSeniors
Claire: The @FTC tells us that this is one of the few scams where consumer education can make a real difference. #ProtectSeniors
Claire: If you are concerned your call could be legitimate, call our Committee’s fraud hotline: http://t.co/wYTotd32aY #ProtectSeniors
(2/2) Claire: ...in one form or another w/o giving you the option on how to pay, that should be another red flag #ProtectSeniors #IRS
Claire: If you find yourself on a phone call w/ someone purporting to be an #IRS agent demanding you send $ … (1/2)
Claire: Furthermore, the #IRS is never going to dictate a method for you to pay what you owe. #ProtectSeniors
Claire: #IRS told us they only use the phone as last resort after sending multiple notices via preferred means of communication: the mail
Claire: I’m going to say something to American ppl that should warm hearts: If you get call out of the blue from the #IRS, don’t answer it
Claire: This scam is incredibly easy to fall for. To the many victims around the country, you should not be ashamed…#ProtectSeniors
Claire: This #IRS impersonation scam doesn't discriminate. We've seen a range of people targeted, young to old. #ProtectSeniors
Claire: W/ Americans focused on #TaxDay, this is an opportunity to call attention to a pervasive scam sweeping the nation. #ProtectSeniors

That's all the #Veterans Day facts for today! To learn more: http://bit.ly/bVOKsv Thank you to all our brave veterans!
Fact #5: It wasn’t until 1978 when the gov’t began observing the #Veterans Day we know today.
Fact #5: On Sept. 20, 1975 Pres. Ford signed a law which returned the annual observance of #Veterans Day to the original date of Nov. 11.
Fact #4: In 1958, the Uniform Holiday Bill moved #Veterans Day to a Monday in Nov. Many did not agree and continued to practice on Nov. 11
Fact #3: In 1938, Nov 11 was officially made a legal holiday, but at the time it was to be celebrated and known as "Armistice Day” #Veterans
Fact #2: In November 1919, President Wilson declared Nov. 11 as the first commemoration of Armistice Day. #Veterans
Veterans Day falls on Nov 11 every year b/c WWI armistice fell on this day in 1918. It was regarded as the end of “the war to end all wars.”
As we observe Veterans Day tomorrow, here's a few facts as to why Nov. 11 is the day we honor our brave #veterans.
